Package com.rad.entity

Class Enemy

java.lang.Object
com.rad.entity.Entity
com.rad.entity.Enemy
public class Enemy
extends Entity
This class defines an Enemy. This includes zombies and other enemies.

id = 10 -> GHOUL id = 11 -> GOLEM id = 12 -> GNAT id = 13 -> GUPPY id = 14 -> BOT id = 15 -> MECH

    • chasePlayers

      public void chasePlayers​(Player player)
      an A* search to find player and capture it How an A* algorithim works is that it places its location in a priority que. This priorityque holds locations and is ordered by the distance in locations from the enemy to a possible point (not nessecarily the distance, but a hueristic that incorporates distance.) in where the enemy can move to. Another data structure is a hashmap that holds all the possible moves that the enemy can move. Then the enemy goes through the priority que, expanding all the best possible moves by distance. If there is a location that meets the goal state, then the enemy moves through the best possible moves to where the player is If the goal state is not found, the enemy explores through the neighbor locations, adding it to the priority que until goal state is found.
      Parameters:
      player -

    • checkPossibleMoveLocations

      public void checkPossibleMoveLocations​(Location currLocation, Location playerLocation, java.util.HashMap<Location,​java.lang.Double> map, java.util.PriorityQueue<Location> pq)
      checks the next possible move state, it uses a hueristic to calculate the best possible move to add to the priority que it uses hypothetical positions that the enemy can go to, then checks the hashmap for the nieghbors and adds it to the que and the map. After that, it adds the best possible position of neighbors to the priority que for the enemy to move to and expand that path.
      Parameters:
      currLocation - it is the location with the next highest priority location
      playerLocation - is the location of the player
      map - is the hash map of all possible move locations
      pq - priority que of the best locations

    • goalStateFound

      public boolean goalStateFound​(java.awt.Rectangle rectangle, Player player, Location location)
      tests whether the goal state is found or not, which is determined if the hypothetical position intersects the player.
      Parameters:
      rectangle - is the rectangle of the hypothetical position the enemy is in
      player - is the player you are trying to capture
      location - is the location you are moving to
      Returns:
      if you found the goal state

    • possibleMoveLocations

      public Location[] possibleMoveLocations​(GameWorld gameWorld, Location enemyLocation, Enemy enemy)
      gets possible locations for enemy, removes all the non possible locations that the enemy can move to
      Parameters:
      gameWorld - the world that contains all the possible entities
      enemyLocation - the (current or hypothetical )location of the enemy
      enemy - the enemy that needs to be moved
      Returns:
      an array of possible locations that the enemy can move to
